title: Can we at the very least have bans in URF? Or maybe earlier surrenders?
body: We know whose going to win before the game even gets going

replies.body:
10 ban system, normal urf.

Homeguard at 15 minutes.

Early FF moved to 10, basic FF at 15.

Why they haven't implemented URF with 10 bans is beyond me. 

Instead we're left with this bastardisation of URF that's supposed to fix the issue but I'm seeing Rumbles and Karthus way more than anyone should in URF.

The reason AR Urf is cancer is two pronged.

1) you can reroll to get a champ you want

2) you are more likely to get champions that were picked more often in earlier urfs.

Which means the fizzes and the hecarims are much more likely to happen and there's simply nothing you can do about it.

This! Wtf. Why do the champs feel so weighted? I've played a few games, around 20 or more probably. Yeah I got to play the OP stuff sometimes, but it's gonna get old quick.

Can I have a source for your 2nd point?

It would incredibly dumb for Riot to not make ARURF actually random, so without a quote from Riot stating as much I'm quite skeptical.

Its less about it being mechanically true, but statistically accurate.. also you have to factor in most of the cancer champions players with limited champion pools will likely own (you know everybody new and veteran owns nasus and garen) + AR accounts which would be very cheap since none of these are really expensive. So in other words, yes its all random but the 1 out of 130+ champs is more like 1 out of whatever is on the account + the % of players that own that specific champion (in which case, is everybody for a lot of these.)

The fact that bans weren't implemented makes this whole event feel really lazy; pretty much feels to me that Riot was doing this purely to make every vocal URF-loving player shut up. It felt lazily conducted, fun games are only when you aren't playing against the oppressive champions, and the lack of bans basically means you're going to see Garen/Annie in nearly every game (they've collectively been in 7/10 games today) due to how nearly everyone has them. 

I played a game today as Rek'Sai against a team consisting of Karthus/Caitlyn/Shaco/Garen/Ashe. Our team had nothing comparable, our bottom laners were slaughtered by Ashe+Garen, Karthus outscaled everyone anyways, and Shaco was damned nightmare once he got AP.

Then there was a game where I was Kayn, who is actually a lot of fun in URF, but I was against Jayce/Aatrox with Warwick. Neither of us had any poke that could compete with Jayce, Aatrox could poke and initiate as Jayce blasted us endlessly, and the rest of our team on the map was completely outpicked as well. I felt so bad for Warwick too - there was literally nothing he could do aside from basically feed. Sure it's RNG, but you can damn well bet that with bans implemented we probably wouldn't have seen Jayce/Garen/Annie nearly as often.

Alternatively, adding some specail URF summoner spells to help people deal with strong URF mechanics could be nice.

And Malzahar should just be disabled. I don't like disabling champions because they're too strong, but his pushing is gamebreaking. Losing all your lanes in 10 minutes to one champion alone isn't fun, it kills the game mode.
